Key Match Events: South Africa have been denied a victory in their T20 World Cup opener after rain meant their reduced fixture against Zimbabwe could not be completed.
Quinton de Kock blasted an 18-ball 47, with eight fours and a six and hogged strike but it was not enough to get them over the line.
Pre-Game Insights: Zimbabwe don't often find themselves in the spotlight, and you'd be forgiven if you don't know too much about them.
Post-Match Reflections: The one point South Africa have dropped could be crucial in the context of the tournament. Assuming there are no major upsets in this group, their match against Pakistan on Thursday becomes a virtual quarterfinal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The first round teams spoke about Test match lengths as being the key to success on this surface
Others: The match was reduced to nine-overs a side due to rain.
